title: POLITICAL Adventures
content:
Did you know? 4 key factors motivating people to choose a specific job: • Daily commute  • The people • The role • Money Usually, all of them are marked as checked, in our case as people who live far (Jerusalem, Dganiya, Misgav-Dov) we have to give up on something. I knew I won't give up the role and the people so I had to compromise on the daily commute- and believe me it's damn hard!. But, at the end of the day I know I made the decision of my life and AppsFlyer did the right thing by accepting me and not rejecting me based on location (like a lot of companies I know).  So what is the must-have factor for you? Shiri Grosbard   Ari C. Applbaum   Benjamin Figdor

title: 7 Rules About HR MANAGEMENT Meant To Be Broken
content:
Did you know?  Being nervous before an interview can sometimes result in you completely blanking or being awkward. Candidates sometimes spill their water or get stuck in the door.  Most of the candidates after such a "tragedy" think it's the end of the world but actually, it's just the opposite!. According to research interviewers tend to like clumsy and honest candidates. So, just be yourself and don't be afraid to spill your cup of water! What is your awkward interview story? mine on the first comment! title: ART Shortcuts - The Easy Way
content:
2 months ago, I had a problem with Greenhouse. I tried to fix it,  asked some of my colleagues in Israel and we didn't get the answer we needed. Then I thought to myself, why don't they come here? There are a lot of customers who need help. I offered  Céline Delle Donne  our Customer Success Manager to host a GH event here@AppsFlyer. 2 days ago we had the event, with more than 70 people and it was amazing! Today  Céline Delle Donne  and  Franklin Aribeana  came to a visit at our office. Thank you GreenHouse for listening to our needs, we really appreciate it. Another amazing friendship with amazing partners to our mission. Special thanks  Cory Dimitrakopoulos   Jon Stross  !

title: The A - Z Guide Of FASHION DESIGN
content:
מגייס גייס מגייס לגיוס זה הגנן גידל דגן בגן החדש!  היי לכולם, כן זה אנחנו המגניבים עם החולצות שמגייסים עכשיו לצוות שלנו בAppsFlyer.אז הנה 10 סיבות להצטרף אלינו: 1. כי יש לנו מלא בדיחות קרש מהסוג הזה (של גנן גידל..). 2. כי אנחנו הצוות הכי מגוון שתפגשו, סורסרים, מגייסים,אדמינים וכולם עובדים כצוות אחד. 3. כי אנחנו לוקחים רעיון ויוצאים איתו לפועל, לא משנה מה מי מו. 4. גם אם זה אומר שבא לנו לעשות חולצות יום לפני כנס, ובאמצע הלילה יש באג כולנו על זה והכל תמיד יהיה מוכן בזמן ( לא דוגמא ספציפית בכלל שקרתה אתמול). 5. כי אנחנו תמיד שם אחד בשביל השני, גם אם יוצאים למילואים, חלד, או חופש תמיד יש על מי לסמוך! 6. כי אנחנו אוהבים אוכל משמין אבל משחקים אותה בריאים. 7. כי כשיש למישהו בעיה, משרה שלא מוצאים לה מענה או כל דבר מהסוג הזה נשב כולנו ביחד עד שנפתור את זה. אה ונמצא פתרון מ-ד-ה-י-ם. בארור. 8. כי אנחנו סופר חדשניים. 9. כי כשיש לנו רעיון גם אם הוא הזוי תמיד כולם זורמים. 10. כי אנחנו יודעים לספור עד 10 (חזרו לסעיף מס' 1).  אז אנחנו מגייסים: Talent Acquisition Specialist  Talent Sourcer Hr Admin ואל תדאגו גם אתם תקבלו חולצה:) אה..ורק כדי לבחון כישורים מינימליים חפשו אותנו אנחנו נשמח לשוחח 3> #AppsFlyer ’sTalent #DreamTeam #Hire @AppsFlyer Inna Milbert   Assaf Schwartz   Yodan Rotholz   Nitzan Scheftelowitz   Neta Sayag   Hadas Goldenberg   Noa Kaplun

title: Who Else Wants To Enjoy POLITICS
content:
الأمور التي أحب أن أقوم بها يوم الجمعه: حملة توظيف! خاصةً أنها لهدف إيجابي مثل  Hasoub أستمتعت كثيرًا بلقائكم، بالتعرف عليكم أكثر والاستماع إلى أموركم الشخصيه. نحن هنا في  #AppsFlyer  لأجلكم! شكرًا للطاقم المبدع: أساف وإينا مدعوون للتوجه إليّ في أي وقت. דברים שאני אוהבת לעשות ביום שישי : ירידי גיוס! ובייחוד שזה למען מטרה טובה כמו Hasoub. נהניתי כל כך לפגוש אתכם, להכיר אתכם טוב יותר ולשמוע את הסיפורים האישיים שלכם. אנחנו בAppsFlyer כאן בשבילכם! תודה לצוות החלומות: מוזמנים לפנות אליי לכל בקשה. Things I like to do on Friday: Recruitment Fairs! And especially for a good cause like Hasoub. I really enjoyed meeting you, getting to know you better and hearing your personal stories. We at AppsFlyer are here for you! Thanks to the dream team:  Inna Milbert   Assaf Schwartz Welcome to contact me for any request. Daniel.Cohen@appsflyer.com

title: Where Can You Find Free ART Resources
content:
הכל התחיל לפני שבוע וחצי או קצת יותר, כשנסעתי לתומי בכביש החוף (נסיעה לא קלה בכלל שדורשת ממני שעות ארוכות של יוגה ומדיטציה כדי לא להתעצבן), כאשר לפתע ראיתי את הסימן 2+ וזה לא היה קלף של טאקי אלא סימון על הכביש. חשכו עיניי כשהבנתי שזה לא נתיב חדש אלא נתיב קיים שהוסב להיות "נתיב שיתופי" או במילותיי, נתיב שאינו מתאים לתושבי הפריפריה כי עם איזה שותף בדיוק אסע למרכז מעמק הירדן?. נתתי לו שם קצת ארוך אבל מאמינה שהבנתם את הפואנטה. באותו היום לקח לי 3.5 שעות להגיע מדגניה להרצליה, יכולתי בזמן הזה לטוס לאיטליה, לנסוע לאילת או לקחת טיסה ליוון אבל היי הכי כיף בעולם להיות באוטו לא? בכל מקרה בימים כאלה אני מתנחמת בעובדה שאני לא צריכה לעשות את זה כל יום כי יש לנו משרד בחיפה!  אם גם אתם הבנתם שהנתיב החדש רק עומד לעשות לנו את החיים קשים יותר ומאסתם בנסיעות למרכז דברו איתי. יש לנו מגוון משרות פתוחות בחיפה ואני ממש ממש אשמח לעזור. פיתוח פרונט, בק, QA וניהול מוצר. Daniel.Cohen@appsflyer.com מזדהים איתי?

title: 11 Methods Of DRAWING Domination
content:
תקציר הפרקים הקודמים: אני לא נורמלית, אני נוסעת כמעט  כל יום מדגניה בכנרת להרצליה.  בשנתיים האחרונות  Ohad Horenstein  , עם עוד כמה אנשים טובים, עסקו בהתפתחות האדירה של קהילות הייטק שקמו באזור הצפון, כחלק מפתרון רחב יותר שמטרתו למשוך הייטק איכותי לאזור. את החודשים האחרונים הקדישו למחקר מעמיק שכלל ראיונות עם אנשי HR, סמנכ״לי פיתוח, מנהלי סייטים מרוחקים של חברות ואנשים שניסו והצליחו/לא הצליחו בעבר. במהלכם ראו את הקושי של חברות במרכז לגייס סניורים ולשמר אותם ומנגד ידע מהכרות אינטימית, באמצעות הקהילות שצצו כפטריות אחרי הגשם, שיש בצפון הייטקיסטים איכותיים. אז החלטנו להקים מעין "קבוצת רכישה" של מפתחים שתהיה מוכנה להצטרף לחברה איכותית וצומחת כעובדים מן המניין, אם זו  תפתח סניף פיתוח באזור. בימים אלה החזון הופך למציאות, במידה וזה מעניין אתכם אתם מוזמנים לפנות ל  Ohad Horenstein  והוא יענה על כל  שאלה. כמובן שאפשר לפנות גם אליי ואשמח לעזור!  Danicohn13@gmail.com

title: It's All About (The) ART
content:
לכבוד העונה החדשה, והאחרונה (😭) של משחקי הכס המשרות שלנו התחפשו לדמויות המפתח מהסדרה. אז איזו משרה אתם? ג׳ון סנואו- software team leader - אתה מנהיג מלידה, התאמנת בקוד על החומה והפכת לטוב ביותר. אתה מוביל אחריך את כולם אבל עדיין HO. דאינריז טאגאריין- General manager- את מובילה צבא שלם מאחורייך בכל העולם. צמחת מעולמות של sales ולדרקונים שלך קוראים EMEA  וLATAM.  סרסיי לאניסטר- UI Product Designer- את רוצה שהדברים יקרו בדיוק כמו שאת רואה אותם. את מעצבת את המציאות של כולם ויודעת בדיוק מה את רוצה. בראן סטארק- Mobile QA Team Leader- אין לך שלוש עיניים אבל אתה רואה הכל לפני שזה קורה ויודע כיצד לפעול. אתה לא נסחב על הגב של הודור אלא ההיפך. טיריון לאניסטר-Director Brand Strategy- אתה יודע לבנות את המותג שלך ויש לך אסטרטגיה מאחורי זה. אתה שופע חוכמה, כריזמה וקסם אישי. אריה סטארק-Talent Acquisition Manager- יש לך אסטרטגיה ברורה, את מחליפה מסכה לכל משרה ואת יודעת בדיוק מה את עושה.  לכל שאלה:  Daniel.Cohen@appsflyer.com *כל המשרות מתאימות לשני המינים*  #appsflyer

title: 7 Easy Ways To Make CRAFT Faster
content:
באסה סבבה? הנה כמה באסה סבבה על המשרות שלנו, כל משרה והבאסה סבבה שלה. Data scientist -רעננה באסה: אתה יותר חכם מרוב החברים שלך סבבה: אתה מנצל את זה לפיתוח אלגוריתמי NLP וML למערכות מסווגות Data Scientist Lead -רעננה באסה: אתה מוביל צוות מחקר שלם וכל האחריות עליך  סבבה: זה צוות חדש אז תוכל לבחור אותם אלגוריתמאי ראייה ממוחשבת-חיפה באסה: יש נוף לים ובחוץ חורף סבבה: אתה מפתח את המערכות הכי מתקדמות בעולם כלי הטיס ראש צוות אלגוריתמיקה-יקנעם  באסה: משרה חדשה חובת ההוכחה עליך סבבה: פיתוח סופר חדשני בתחום הרכב האוטונומי  מתכנת גראפיקה תלת מימדית-נתניה באסה: נמאס לנו לראות סימפסונס בדו מימד סבבה: אתה תוכל לעזור לנו אלגוריתמאי בכיר-חולון באסה: אסור לספר סבבה: אסור לספר בכלל שרדתם עד כאן? סבבה! תגישו קוח שלא תרגישו באסה  Daniel.Cohen3@elbitsystems.com *כל המשרות פונות לשני המינים*

title: Avoid The Top 10 ART Mistakes
content:
לכל מי שלא דובר אלביטאית, הכנתי לכם תרגום מאלביטאית לעברית. גילוי נאות: גם אני עדיין לא מדברת אלביטאית שוטפת. מתכנת גראפיקה ממוחשבת תלת מימדית- שם עצם, מפתח קוד 3D של כל המערכות הכי מגניבות שלנו, כולל רכבים אוטונומיים, בזמנו הפנוי משחק בפורטנייט. Data Scientist- שם עצם, חוקר/ת ביחידת הסייבר שלנו, עושה את הבלתי אפשרי בעיקר בתחומי NLP  וML, מציל את ביטחון המדינה תוך כדי שהוא קורא תגובות בצרות בהייטק. Data Scientist Lead-  שם עצם, מוביל את הארבעה בשורה הקודמת, רק שיש לו גם דוקטורט. מהנדס אלגוריתמי תקשורת- שם עצם, בעל תואר שלישי שלא חייב ניסיון בפיתוח אלגוריתמים אך חייב רצון להיות אחד כזה. חוקר Deep Learning- שם עצם, מתמחה בראייה ממוחשבת וDeep Learning, יעסוק בפלטפורמות אוטונומיות ביחידת תקשוב וסייבר, שונא לנהוג. אלגוריתמאי לתחום מכ"ם ול"א- שם עצם, אלגוריתמאי במעצמת המכ"ם הבלתי מעורערת-אלישרא, שרשראות שידור וקליטה זה הלחם וחמאה שלו, אהב תעופה עוד מגיל 4. חוקר בכיר לתחום תקשורת ועיבוד אות- שם עצם, כשהמציאו את הWIFI  הוא לא היה מופתע, שיחק עם מודמים במגמת אלקטרוניקה, מפתח אלגוריתמי עיבוד אות מתוך שינה. מפתח אלגוריתמים- שם עצם, מפתח אלגוריתמי עיבוד תמונה וראייה ממוחשבת למשהו שאפילו כאן אי אפשר לספר עליו, ישן 8 שעות בלילה כי הוא מאוד רגוע.  מצאתם משרה שמעניינת אתכם? מצוין, אני מחכה להודעה  Daniel.Cohen3@elbitsystems.com *המשרות פונות לשני המינים**

title: Best 50 Tips For BANKING
content:
אמ:לק המשרה עלולה להכיל טיסות לשוויץ אנחנו מחפשים מהנדס אלגוריתמים מכ"ם לסיגמא ביט, ב"ש. סיגמא ביט מפתחת מכ"ם ראשון מסוגו בעולם, לפרויקט ראשון מסוגו בעולם, פורץ דרך מבחינה אלגוריתמאית וטכנולוגית. וכן,  זה עבור חברה שוויצירית.  הפיתוח מתחיל מאפס, לא מתבססים על משהו קיים- וזה לא רק נשמע טוב. קצת על המכ"ם- מכ"ם Multibeam  FMCW מוטס. מל"ט שנע בנתיבי טיסה אזרחיים, והם כבר עברו ניסויי טיסה מוצלחים.  דרישות: תואר ראשון ומעלה בהנדסת חשמל / פיזיקה- חובה אהבה לשוקולד- יתרון לפחות 3 שנות ניסיון בהנדסת מערכת מכ"ם / עיבוד אות מכ"ם ידע בעיבוד אותות ספרתי רצון לטייל יום אחד באלפים השוויצרים- יתרון ידע בהסתברות ותהליכים אקראיים הבנה מערכתית של שרשראות שידור / קליטה מרגישים שזה זה? מכירים מישהו "בול"? דברו איתי! title: If You Do Not (Do)ZOOLOGY Now, You Will Hate Yourself Later

הידעת?  •	המצאת המכ"ם מיוחסת לבריטים, אך הפטנט הראשון על המכ"ם נרשם בגרמניה ב-1904.בזמן מלחמת העולם השנייה סייעו מערכות מכ"ם מגלה מטוסים לבריטניה להתמודד עם התקפות חיל-האוויר הגרמני והיוו את מערכת ההגנה האווירית הראשונה.    •	השימוש הראשון בכלי נשק מבוסס מכ"ם היה בטיל שיוט אמריקני בשם עטלף במאי 1945, סוף מלחמת העולם השנייה. בחודש זה הצליח העטלף להטביע צוללת יפנית ממרחק של כ-32 ק"מ.    •	השימוש במכ"מים אינו מסתכם רק בסיוע לכלי לחימה, הוא מסייע בחקר החלל, גילוי אוניות ומטוסים להתרעת התנגשות, מעקב אחר ציפורים, תחזיות מזג אוויר ואיתור המיקום של סופות ברקים וכמובן מערכות נהיגה אוטונומיות בהן מכ"מים קטנים מודדים מרחקים ומהירויות של המכונית ביחס לסביבתה ומאפשרים למכונה לנהוג באוטו ללא התערבות אדם. נשמע לכם מעניין? יש לכם ניסיון במכ"ם? מצוין! לאתרי ב"ש וחולון אנחנו מחפשים מהנדס/ת אלגוריתמים מכ"ם. דברו איתי  Daniel.Cohen3@elbitsystems.com **ניסיון במערכות מכ"ם-חובה Meital Mendelawy

title: Cracking The PROGRAMMING Code
content:
A few years back, I watched a professor ask a class "If there are two equally qualified 27-year old candidates and the only difference was their gender, who should you hire?"  10 minutes in, the whole class agreed that there was no "better" candidate. The professor proceeded to tell us that the woman may be thinking about kids and go on maternity leave at that age. He started to call the woman at one point "the risk" and the lesson was to mitigate risk in hiring.  His argument was that women are inherently risky investments, even when all the data shows otherwise.   This month, I kept thinking back to this one lesson in college, equating risk to women. And now with a female Vice President-elect, I can't help but be excited for a future when women are able to prove this lesson wrong.

title: Why I Hate CRAFT
content:
COVID-19 has caused me to reevaluate my own ego.  How could I complain when I still have my job?  How could I not continue to accelerate my career when I have all this extra free time from my commute?  Why am I not as productive when I have more time for self-care?  When I’ve been faced with tough times in the past, I’ve always assumed that I’ll just “figure it out”.  But if this experience has taught me anything personally, it’s that if I want to be a good future leader, colleague, sister, or friend, I have to be able to have sympathy not only for others, but also for myself and my own circumstances.

title: How I Improved My PROGRAMMING In One Day
content: 1. Titanic Survival Project: This is a beginner’s project on Kaggle that is best for you if you are just getting started with ML projects. This deals with the Titanic disaster which is one of the most famous in marine history. All you have to do in the project is predict which passengers survived the Titanic shipwreck based on data such as their age, gender, socio-economic class, etc. For example, it is highly probable that someone rich from the first class survived as compared to someone from the third class. You can use the Titanic dataset on Kaggle for this project. And just to make things more interesting, this dataset contains real data based on the people who died and survived the actual Titanic disaster.

title: Improve(Increase) Your GRAPHIC In 3 Days
content: 2. Personality Prediction ProjectImagine how interesting it would be to read the posts written by people online and be able to understand their overall personality. It would solve a lot of confusion on the internet! This ML project aims to find the Myers-Briggs personality of a person based on the types of posts they put on social media. Myers Briggs Type Indicator is a personality identification system that divides a person into one of 16 different personalities based on introversion, intuition, thinking, and perceiving capabilities. The axis ranges from Introversion (I) to Extroversion (E), Intuition (N) to Sensing (S), Thinking (T) to Feeling (F), and Judging (J) to Perceiving (P). You can use the Personality prediction dataset available on Kaggle to create the ML project.

title: Proof That SCIENCE Is Exactly What You Are Looking For
content: 3. Loan Prediction Project It’s not at all easy to get a loan from the bank. Getting a loan approved requires a complex mix of factors not the least of which is a steady income! So this ML project aims to create a model that will classify how much loan the user can obtain based on various factors such as the user’s marital status, income, education, employment prospects, number of dependents, etc. The Loan prediction data set provides details about all these factors which can then be used to create an ML model that demonstrates the amount of loan that can be approved.

title: 5 Actionable Tips on GST And Twitter.
content: 4. Stock Price Prediction ProjectThe stock market is an ever-changing field with many highs and lows as companies succeed or go under. It is notoriously difficult to predict the stock market but that’s what this ML project is all about. You will predict the future stock price returns based on the past stock market data like opening price, closing price, trading volume, calculated returns, etc. as well as the news data like news articles published about company assets, etc. This stock market dataset on Kaggle contains all the data that you can use for the project.

title: ART: This Is What Professionals Do
content: 5. Xbox Game Prediction ProjectWho doesn’t like Xbox gaming? Most people do and there are a lot of options for them to choose from! This project aims to predict which Xbox game a person will be most interested in based on their search queries online. And you can use the prediction dataset provided by BestBuy, a consumer electronics company that provides data on the search queries of millions of customers to understand what Xbox game they might be interested in. The data contains the user ID, the item that the user clicked on, the category the item belongs to, the query, click time, and query time.

title: 27 Ways To Improve ART
content: 6. Housing Prices Prediction Project There are a lot of factors that determine the price of a house including its location, size, number of rooms, etc. But people ignore many of these factors while buying or selling a house. That’s where this project comes in! It provides many factors for the house like its frontage, area, street, land contour, utilities, proximity, garage quality, roof materials, etc. with the ultimate aim of predicting the final price of the house based on these factors. You can get the Housing Prices Prediction Project dataset for Kaggle and use it to create an ML algorithm that can accurately predict house prices based on these factors.

title: 5 Simple Steps To An Effective POLITICS Strategy
content: 7. Sales Prediction ProjectWhat if shops could estimate the products that they sell every month? That’s what this project aims to accomplish. You have to forecast the total amount of products that are sold in each shop while you are provided with the daily sales data. And the project is dynamic as well because the list of shops and products may change every month. You can get the sales data set to create this ML project on Kaggle. The data set contains a training set and the test set for which you need to forecast the sales. This project on Kaggle is also part of the final project of the "How to win a data science competition" course on Coursera.

title: A Guide To GST At Any Age
content: 8. Digit Recognizer ProjectThis is an ML project that will improve your computer vision skills tremendously! You need to create an ML algorithm to identify the identified digits from a dataset that has other handwritten images as well. And there’s a lot of data! The data set contains tens of thousands of images of which some are handwritten digits as well. Before starting this project, you must brush up on your skills in simple neural networks and Classification methods such as Support Vector Machine and K-nearest neighbors. You can obtain the dataset required for this project on Kaggle.

title: Why You Never See BANKING That Actually Works
content: 9. Credit Card Approval Prediction Not everyone can obtain a credit card with ease. The bank decides whether or not to issue a credit card based on multiple factors that demonstrate how trustworthy the person is. And credit scores objectively quantify this trust factor and the amount of risk. So this project aims to create an ML model that can find out if an applicant is a ‘good’ or ‘bad’ client for obtaining a credit card. The dataset for this contains data such as annual income, income category, education level, way of living, etc. to decide whether the applicant is suitable for obtaining a credit card or not.

title: The Ultimate Secret Of GRAPHIC
content: 10. IMDB Box Office Prediction Movies are a big part of our world! But nobody knows how a movie will perform at the box office. There are some big-budget movies that bomb and there are smaller movies that are smashing successes. This project tries to predict the overall worldwide box office revenue of movies using data such as the movie cast, crew, posters, plot keywords, budget, production companies, release dates, languages, and countries. The dataset on Kaggle contains all these data points that you can use to predict how a movie will fare at the box office.

Some of the most important things I learned were how to collaborate with a team, how to communicate effectively, how to manage my time efficiently, how to write clean and efficient code, and how to learn quickly and adapt to new technologies.From Classroom to Corporate: My SDE Internship Experience

content: Balancing work and school can be a challenge, especially during an SDE internship. In this post, I share my own experience with balancing these two commitments and offer tips for managing your time effectively.My Mentor's Impact on My SDE Internship

title: 14 Days To A Better CRAFT
content: Having a mentor can make a huge difference during an SDE internship. In this post, I talk about my mentor and the impact he had on my professional development. I also share tips for finding and building a relationship.

title: 10 Ways To Reinvent Your DANCE
content: Fake News Detection Using Python : Fake news does not require any introduction. It is very much easy to spread all the fake information in today’s all-connected world across the internet. Fake news is sometimes transmitted through the internet by some unauthorized sources, which creates issues for the targeted person and it makes them panic and even violence. To combat the spread of fake news, it’s critical to determine the information’s legitimacy, which this Data Science project can help with. To do so, Python can be used, and a model is created using TfidfVectorizer. PassiveAggressiveClassifier can be implemented to distinguish between true and fake news. Pandas, NumPy, and sci-kit-learn are some Python packages suitable for this project, and we can utilize News.csv for the dataset. Source Code – Fake news detection using python

title: How To Use SCIENCE To Desire
content: Data Science Project on Detecting Forest Fire : Developing a project for identifying the forest fire and wildfire system is an alternatively good example to exhibit one’s skills in Data Science. The forest fire or wildfire is an uncontrollable fire that develops in a forest. All the  forest fir will create havoc during weekends on the animal habitat, surrounding environment and human property. k-means clustering can be used for the identification of the  crucial hotspots during forest fire  and to reduce the  severity , to regulate them and even  to predict the behaviour of the wildfire. This is advantageous for allocating the required resources. To enhance the model’s accuracy, it is ideal to use climatological data to find out the common periods and seasons for wildfires. Source Code – Detecting Forest Fire

title: Here Is A Method That Is Helping ZOOLOGY
content: Detection of Road Lane Lines : A Live Lane-Line Detection Systems built-in Python language is another Data Science project idea for beginners. A human driver receives lane detecting instruction from lines placed on the road in this project. The lines placed on the roads indicate where the lanes are located for human driving. It also refers to the vehicle’s steering direction. This application is crucial for the development of self-driving cars. This application for the Data Science Project is critical for the development of self-driving cars.Source Code – Detection of Road Lane Lines

title: How To Become Better With POLITICAL In 10 Minutes
content: Project on Sentiment Analysis : The act of evaluating words to determine sentiments and opinions that may be positive or negative in polarity is known as sentimental analysis. This is a sort of categorization in which the classifications are either binary (optimistic or pessimistic) or multiple (happy, angry, sad, disgusted, etc.). The project is written in R Language, and the dataset provided by the Janeausten R package is used. The general-purpose lexicons like AFINN, bing, and Loughran are used to execute an inner join and present the results using a word cloud. Source Code – Project on Sentimental Analysis

title: Are You Making These PAINTING Mistakes?
content: Project on Influences of Climatic Pattern on the food chain supply globally : The abnormalities and changes occurring in the climate very often are the main challenges on the environment that need to be taken care of. These environmental changes will affect the human beings on earth. This Data Science Project makes an attempt to analyze the changes in the food production globally that occurs due to change in climatic conditions. The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the consequences of climatic changes on primary agricultural yields. This project will evaluate all the effects related to change in temperature and rainfall pattern. The amount of carbon dioxide that impacts plant development and the uncertainties in climate change will next be considered. As a result, data representations will be the primary focus of this project. It will also assess productivity across different locations and geographical regions.

title: What Can Instagramm Teach You About FASHION DESIGN
content: Project on  Speech Recognition through Emotions : One of the fundamental strategies for us to communicate ourselves is the speech, and it involves various feelings including silence, anger, happiness, and passion etc. It is possible to use the emotions behind the speech to reorganize our emotions, the service we offer, and the end products to deliver a custom-made service to particular persons by evaluating the emotions behind it. The main aim of this project is to identify and get the feelings from multiple files involving sound that comprises the human speech. Python’s SoundFile, Librosa,, NumPy, Scikit-learn, and PyAaudio packages can be used to produce something alike. In addition, you can use the Ryerson Audio-Visual Database of Emotional Speech and Song (RAVDESS) for the dataset containing over 7300 files. Source Code – Speech Emotion Analyzer and Speech Emotion Recognition

title: What Alberto Savoia Can Teach You About HR MANAGEMENT
content: Project on Gender Detection and Age Prediction : This project on detecting the gender and predicting the age identified as a classification challenge, will put your Machine Learning and Computer Vision skills to work. The goal is to create a system that can analyze a person’s photograph and determine their age and gender. Python and the OpenCV library to implement Convolutional Neural Networks can be used for this entertaining project. For this project, the Adience dataset can be downloaded. Remember that factors like cosmetics, lighting, and facial expressions will make this difficult, and try to throw your model off. Source Code – Gender Detection and Age Prediction

title: Clear And Unbiased Facts About ART (Without All the Hype)
content: Project on Developing Chatbots : Chatbots are important for companies since this project can answer all the questions posed by the clients and information without the process slowing down. The customer support workload has been decreased by the procedures which are fully automated. This process can be easily obtained by implementing Machine Learning,  Artificial Intelligence and Data Science techniques. Chatbots operate by assessing the customer’s input and responding with a mapped response. Recurrent Neural Networks using the intentions JSON dataset may be used to train the chatbot, while Python can be used to implement it. The objective of the chatbot will determine whether it is domain-specific or open-domain. Source Code – Developing Chatbots

title: What Zombies Can Teach You About POLITICAL
content: Project on Detection of Drowsiness in Drivers : Sleepy drivers are one of the causes of road accidents, which claim many fatalities each year. Because drowsiness is a possible cause of road danger, one of the best methods to avoid it is to install a drowsiness detection system. Another technology that can save many lives is a driver sleepiness detection system that continuously assesses the driver’s eyes and alerts him with alarms if the system detects that the driver closes his eyes very often. A webcam is required for this project for the system to monitor the driver’s eyes regularly. This Python project will require a deep learning model as well as packages such as OpenCV, TensorFlow, Pygame, and Keras to do this. Source Code – Driver Drowsiness Detection and Driver Drowsiness Detection

title: How To Save Money with PAINTING?
content: Project on Diabetic Retinopathy : Diabetic Retinopathy is a primary cause of blindness in people with diabetes. An automated diabetic retinopathy screening system can be developed. On retina photographs of both damaged and healthy people, a neural network can be trained. This research will determine whether or not the patient has retinopathy. Source Code – Diabetic Retinopathy Detection and Diabetic Retinopathy Detection Topics

title: PROGRAMMING? It's Easy If You Do It Smart
content: Project on Detection of Credit Card Fraud : Credit card fraud is more widespread than you might believe, and it’s been on the rise recently. By the end of 2022, we’ll have crossed a billion credit card users, metaphorically. However, credit card firms have been able to successfully identify and intercept these frauds with significant accuracy because of advancements in technology such as Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and Data Science. Simply stated, the concept is to examine a customer’s regular spending pattern, involving locating the geography of such spendings, to distinguish between fraudulent and non-fraudulent transactions. The languages R or Python can be used to ingest the customer’s recent transactions as a dataset into decision trees, Artificial Neural Networks, and Logistic Regression for this project. The system’s overall accuracy would increases if additional data is fed. Source Code – Credit Card Fraud Detection and Credit Card Fraud Topics

title: How To Make Your POLITICAL Look Amazing In 5 Days
content: Project on Customer Segmentations : One of the most well-known Data Science projects is customer segmentation. Companies build various groupings of customers before launching any marketing. Customer segmentation is a prominent unsupervised learning application. Companies utilize clustering to discover client groupings and target the possible user base. They classify clients based on shared traits such as gender, age, interests, and spending habits to market to each group successfully. Visualization of the gender and age distributions can be done using K-means clustering. Then their annual earnings and spending habits are also analyzed. Source Code – Customer Segmentations and Customer Segmentations Topics

title: OPERATING SYSTEM Is Crucial To Your Business. Learn Why!
content: Project on the recognition of traffic signals : Traffic signs and rules are extremely crucial to observe to avoid any accidents. To observe the guideline, one must first comprehend the appearance of the traffic sign. Before receiving a driver’s license, a person must first study all of the traffic signs. However, automated vehicles are on the rise, and in the not-too-distant future, there will be no human drivers. In the Traffic Signs Recognition project, you’ll discover how software can use a picture as input to recognize the type of traffic sign. The German Traffic Signs Recognition Benchmark dataset (GTSRB) is used to train a Deep Neural Network that can identify the class of a traffic sign. A simple graphical user interface (GUI) to communicate with the application can also be created. Python can be used. Source Code – Traffic Sign Detection, Traffic Sign Detection Using Capsule Networks, and Traffic Sign Recognition

title: Secrets To Getting DRAWING To Complete Tasks Quickly And Efficiently
content: Project on recommendation System for Films : In this data science project, the language R can be used to generate a machine learning-based movie recommendation. A recommendation system uses a filtering procedure to send forth suggestions to users based on other users’ interests and browsing history. If A and B enjoy Home Alone and B enjoys Mean Girls, it can be recommended to A; they may enjoy it as well. Customers will be more engaged with the platform as a result of this. Source Code – Recommendation System for Films

title: 3 Ways You Can Reinvent FASHION DESIGN Without Looking Like An Amateur
content: Project on Breast Cancer Classification : Breast cancer cases have been on the rise in recent years, and the best approach to combat it is to detect it early and adopt appropriate preventive measures. To develop such a system with Python, the model can be trained on the IDC(Invasive Ductal Carcinoma) dataset, which provides histology images for cancer-inducing malignant cells. Convolutional Neural Networks are better suited for this project, and NumPy, OpenCV, TensorFlow, Keras, sci-kit-learn, and Matplotlib are among the Python libraries that can be utilized.

title: DRAWING: Do You Really Need It? This Will Help You Decide!
content: Landing Page : You can consider creating an enriching Landing Page as your very first Web Development project. But…what is a Landing Page? Okay, a Landing Page is an independent web page that is mainly created to market or advertise for a particular product or service in the e-commerce field. A Landing Page can be created using HTML and CSS; where you’ll be required to create the basic structure for the page such as adding header & footer, creating columns, sections dividing along with creating a navigation bar, background, styling, etc. You need to consider several crucial outlooks also such as padding, margin, spacing, etc. to make it more creative and engaging. To make the Landing Page more appealing and dynamic, you can use JavaScript as well for integrating features like Scroll Effect and other additional custom functionalities.

title: Stop Wasting Time And Start OPERATING SYSTEM
content: Survey Form : Another beginner level project that comes on this list is the Survey Form. A Survey Form is commonly used for getting feedback, customer preferences or requirements, and other related information from the users. You can opt for designing and creating a responsive and creative Survey Form to validate your HTML and CSS skills. In this project, the HTML will allow you to create the structure of the form and add various input fields for the users’ data such as name, age, contact details, etc. and CSS will enable you to do the styling for the input fields and the entire form such as field size, background color and much more. Also, JavaScript can be used in the form for validation tasks like character limit for input fields, email id format validation, etc.

title: How To Make Your DANCE Look Like A Million Bucks
content: Personal Blog : How would it be if you can make a project that will not only help you to enhance your web development skills but also act as a platform to share your learning or experiences with others? Yes, a Personal Blog can do the same. Though a blog can be created from basic to advanced level, initially you’re recommended to opt for creating a basic blogging site using HTML, CSS, and jQuery. And, if you’re having sound knowledge of CSS Grid, Flexbox, Responsive Design, and other related concepts, it would be more beneficial for you to create an enriching Personal Blog project. Meanwhile, Bootstrap also allows you to create a responsive blog that can run on different screen sizes conveniently and efficiently.

title: How To Win Buyers And Influence Sales with PHOTOGRAPHY
content: Business Portfolio Website : In today’s digitally driven world when almost every business is going online, you can opt to make a simple static Business Portfolio Website as a beginner-level project. It can be based on any particular business such as restaurant, fashion wear, sports gears, etc and what you need to do is showcase the products & services offered by the business along with adding respective images, prices, contact details, etc. In this project, you will be mainly using your HTML and CSS skills to create the structure and layout for the website. You need to add all these product images in an aligned manner and use the grid system to build a multi-column layout. Also, once you’ll become a pro with web development skills, you can consider creating an advanced dynamic website for the same business platform.

title: Want More Money? Start DRAWING
content: Calculator : For a beginner who is having the fundamental knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, a Calculator project with basic arithmetic operations functionalities like addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division will be very relevant to him. You need to build a creative interface with buttons for providing the input and a display screen for showing the values. The CSS Grid can be used for the alignment of buttons and a screen in a grid-like format. Also, you need to possess a decent knowledge of If-else statements, loops, operators, JavaScript functions, event listeners, etc. as a prerequisite. For instance, the onclick attribute will determine the functionality when a click happens. By the time when you become more proficient with the web development tools & technologies, you can consider adding advanced functionalities to this calculator project.

title: The A - Z Guide Of DRAWING
content: To-Do List App : A To-Do List App will have an interactive and responsive interface where you will be able to create multiple to-do lists for daily tasks and add or remove the items from the list conveniently. For this project, you’ll be required to have the basic knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, and Bootstrap. Also, the knowledge of how the grid system in Bootstrap works will be more beneficial. You will need to create JavaScript methods in this project mainly for the following tasks – for adding the user input to the list, deleting the elements from the lists, showing the items on the screen, etc. After integrating the basic functionalities like adding or removing items, creating multiple lists, etc. – you can opt to add new functionalities as well such as grouping the lists, task completion status, and various others as per your convenience.

title: How To Teach HR MANAGEMENT Better Than Anyone Else
content: Address Book Project : Let’s check out another web development project for beginners – Address Book. The Address Books Project will be a personal platform where you can keep track of the contact details such as phone number, email-ID, address, etc. of your friends, family, colleagues, and others. You can start to build this particular project considering these basic features – adding a new contact, saving it, and search & view contacts. Several additional features that can also be considered are – editing an existing contact, deleting a contact, etc. Though the entire programming for the project can be done using fundamental HTML, CSS, and JavaScript, you can also use an API that generates placeholder data and can structure the JSON as per your skill level. You need to know that an Address Book Project can be created from the basic to the advanced level, so try to build it from the basic level first.

title: 15 Tips For OPERATING SYSTEM Success
content: Quiz Game Project : Developing a Quiz Game is also a worthwhile option for all the beginners who are looking forward to building a web development project. In this project, what you have to do is create a web page that will show several multiple-choice options with 4 options and the result of the quiz will be displayed at the end when the user will submit the test. You need to use your HTML skills to set up the structure and CSS skills to make the page look more engaging and creative. The JavaScript will be responsible for tasks like – identifying if the answer is correct or not, responding accordingly for correct & wrong answers, displaying the result on submit, etc. in this project. You will get to learn various fundamental concepts such as DOM manipulation, eventListeners, arrays, etc. while working on this project.

title: DANCE Made Simple - Even Your Kids Can Do It
content: Meme Generator Project : Who doesn’t love memes? Everyone does! But do you know that you can create your own meme generator using basic web development skills? Okay, let us tell you how. You need to have a decent knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to build this responsive meme generator that will allow you to create custom memes by adding funny or sarcastic captions to the images. You can use HTML to create the structure for the platform and input fields for getting images and text lines from the users and CSS can be used to make it look better. And then you need to use the JavaScript code to update the image and generate an awesome meme. You can also add several additional functionalities like downloading, sharing of the meme, etc. as per your convenience.

title: Find A Quick Way To ZOOLOGY
content: E-Library Project : Lastly, here comes another remarkable project – E-Library, for all the beginners out there. It can actually be considered as a beginner to intermediate level project. As a beginner, you can opt to create a static website to showcase the library details such as books, contact details, etc to the users. Here you can use HTML for structuring the website, CSS for designing and styling part, and JavaScript for validation tasks. And for the intermediate level, you can create a website for a library where a user can log in with the provided credentials and can explore which books are available in the library and several other aspects. For this project, along with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript – you’re required to have a decent knowledge of database and SQL as well and knowledge of programming languages like PHP etc. will be more preferred.

title: Need More Time? Read These Tips To Eliminate CRAFT
content:
“Honestly, I’ve been working a lot on myself and getting my mental health in check.”  I asked a friend recently how she was doing in her business, and was a little taken back by this answer. There was almost an internal sigh of “me too” which she spoke about working on her own happiness. I didn't feel the same pressure to "show off" how much I work or how long my hours are. I actually found myself smiling more.  The competitive  #hustle  mentality becomes unhealthy so quickly.  Putting on events about mental health like Impact Mentality and talking more about it these past couple of months has made me realize how many people are struggling to just keep okay.  When was the last time you thought about the state of your mental resilience?  #mentalhealth   #resiliency   #entrepreneurship   #hardwork

Joel and I were finishing our degrees when we met and now we host events and activations all over North America. title: Picture Your HR MANAGEMENT On Top. Read This And Make It So
content:

title: How I Improved My BUSINESS In One Easy Lesson
content:
I started 2018 with NO JOB, NO DEGREE, and 200,000 followers on Linkedin. This year has been a complete 180 for me. Throughout 2018, I... - Doubled my follower count to 400,000 on Linkedin - Received my 3rd Linkedin Top Voice Award - Graduated from the University of Southern California - Joined the team at Studio71 - Was featured in Adweek, Inc, and more - Guest podcasted on 10+ shows - Spoke at 10+ events internationally - Hosted 5 events in San Francisco and LA - Helped launch  Impact Mentality I learned 3 major things: 1) Your goals should constantly be changing. You can't predict in January what opportunities are going to come in the next 12 months. 2) Execution is more important than your age. People will listen to a 22 year-old if they have already proven results.  3) Don't think that because you aren't going to that party on Saturday that you are "missing out". If you want to spend all of your birthday, Christmas, and New Years Eve working at coffee shops, do it.  #podcasts   #studentsoflinkedin   #hardwork   #2018inReview

Ran across this tweet from  Jeremy Becker  the other day, and I think it perfectly summed up how I believe our culture of "hustle harder" has negatively affected the competitive workplace. The number of times I have told myself "You can't put down your phone. You are replaceable. You have to work harder" has hit unhealthy levels in the past. What do you think? What do you think will be the differentiator for employees going forward? CC:  Sam Park   Angela H. title: Learn Exactly How We Made BUSINESS Last Month
content:
Born in 1996, I sit on the cusp of Millennials and Gen Z. I remember 9/11, but I can’t remember what it was like to have a cell phone without data.  As a Gen Z-er, I focus on saving money as much as possible. But when I do spend, I spend it like a Millennial (i.e. on experiences).  I am sitting at a WorldZ session led by Viacom, and I can’t help but think about how weird it is to hear people of another generation name and define my generation.  As a marketer, I totally understand wanting to target audiences. But what I notice from these kinds of talks are the lack of Gen Z people in the room, contributing to the conversation about what they are like. I am so curious as to how the conversation about Gen Z will change once younger people start actively participating in the conversation.  #marketing   #genz   #millennials   #targetaudience   #generationaldifferences

title: The Best Way To PAINTING
content:
“What you don’t see is the years of crying myself to sleep. We go on stage and talk about how great we are, but never mention the pain it took to get here. We fail to talk about how many entrepreneurs, public speakers, and professionals have anxiety attacks on the regular. It sucks. You have to want it more than anything.” Years ago I was at an fireside chat and someone asked the entrepreneur how he gets through the times of doubt. That was his answer. While I love to share these moments on stage or with friends, let’s not forget that social media doesn’t show the nights of working and worrying. We’re all going through it.

When I first started as the Linkedin Campus Editor at USC, I didn't even attend the college yet.    I was about to transfer from UC Irvine, and spent hours after class driving back and forth between Irvine and South LA to meet with students about the platform and how they could create content on it. By my 3rd day as an official USC student, I was on the front page of the university newspaper.  The Campus Editor Program was imperative in my career, but also in my self-image, teaching me to stretch myself beyond my "student" title and to express myself online. The community aspect made it one of my most rewarding experiences to date.    Being an alumni of the program, I have had the privilege working with  Joel Hansen  and  Annette H. , and I am proud that in August we are heading up the first Campus Editor Meetup at  LinkedIn  HQ in the San Fransisco Bay Area.    Thank you to  Maya Pope-Chappell  and all the Campus Editors that I have had the privilege of meeting along the way:  Hana J. ,  Tim Salau ,  Cornelius McGrath ,  Frederick Daso ,  Manu Goswami ,  Kate J. ,  Cheechee L. ,  Tiara Conley ,  Scarlett H. ,  Will Lawrence ,  Nathan Chiu ,  Leann Abad ,  Makenzee Frohlich ,  Casey Rosen , and so many more.

title: The Best Way To MUSIC
content:
As colleges are finishing up #graduations, most graduates will starting at the "entry level". I've seen so many of my friends job-hop, thinking that they will rise up the ranks faster.  Churning through companies doesn't mean you are on an upward trajectory. Most of these switches after 12-18 months at one company are to a similar level position. And then they get mad when their work isn't #meaningful .  To my fellow recent grads: How about we focus on the #impact of our work and the value we brought to a company  - over -  what title we have and the number of months we have been there.  We ARE acting entitled. It's time to start earning those titles through action and not words on a paper. #10tips10days  Kira Day   Bobby Umar   Lila Smith   Jake Jordan

title: 5 Brilliant Ways To Use PROGRAMMING
content:
I revisited my first popular Linkedin article, "How I Overcame My Lack of Work Experience." Here's why it succeeded ⬇ 1️⃣ It addressed what my #audience WANTED to read --- You have to find your audience, and then create content that fits what that demographic looks for on that platform.  My audience in 2015 = students, job seekers, & recruiters 2️⃣ It was SHORT --- People tend to read on the internet at a 3rd grade level. Shorter is usually better, regardless of the #algorithm .  3️⃣  It FIT the platform for the time.  --- I have people asking "How do you make a successful article in 2018? I want to write something like that one on overcoming lack of experience." Don't. That worked for 2015. 2018 favors short form posts, topical articles, and video.  What has worked for you? What has been your most viral piece?  I would love to hear from  Sam Park   Tiffany Parra   Fabio Marrama   Alexandra Galviz (Authentic Alex)  on why they think a particular piece of their content has done so well on the platform.  #10Tips10Days  Bobby Umar   Lila Smith   Jake Jordan   Kira Day

title: Use SCIENCE To Make Someone Fall In Love With You
content:
When I graduated high school, college was the expected next step. For the past four years, I have had friends attend classes with me. I’ve had friends drop out to start their own companies. And, I’ve had friends succeed and fail at turning their education into work opportunities. What I learned is that college isn’t for everyone, but the  University of Southern California  was the best option for me. People have different paths to success, and each has its own unique pros and cons. I wouldn’t want my little brother to feel pressured to do something just because his friend, his brother, or older sister did it. You have to do what’s best for you. #education  #graduation

title: The Next 3 Things To Immediately Do About DANCE

title: Ho To (Do) POLITICAL Without Leaving Your Office(House).

Here are my top tips for dealing with high anxiety at work:  1️⃣Grayscale your screen: it's scientifically proven to reduce your inclination to click on useless notifications & can help clear your mind 2️⃣Switch to tea over coffee: tea will give you calmer energy and help avoid more anxiety from a caffeine rush 3️⃣Remember the greater purpose: remember why you decided to join your position or industry. What is this all for? Even though it's Friday, work can sometimes be overwhelming. I used to really struggle with anxiety in the workplace, but these tips have helped me manage it over time. Do you have any suggestions?  Day 10 of #30DS  #StudentVoices #anxiety #letsgethonest

title: Never Lose Your OPERATING SYSTEM Again
content:
I have always rejected comments that I needed a mentor. I thought it implied that one main mentor would have a crazy amount of influence over my career. “I was picturing this Mister Miyagi type of relationship that ultimately changes your life and your perception around life” - Hootsuite’s CEO, Ryan Holmes. I know far too many college students that send out these emails to big names in the business, praying for that one mentor that will open all the doors for them. All the while, they are meeting hundreds of people with great advice and passing on the opportunity to capitalize on their generosity.  Mentors are everywhere.  Day 8 of #30DS

With LinkedIn creators pushing out so much content, the usual suspects for content on LinkedIn have been redefined and expanded. So while it's not "everyone", I've definitely struggled with defining my audience and content down to a single niche.  Have you felt the same? title: A Surprising Tool To Help You POLITICS
content:
Too many people don’t understand the value they bring.  “How do I go about making a strong personal brand?”  “How do I get noticed by employers/investors?” I was recently inspired by  Fabio Marrama 's and  Tiffany Parra 's posts on the value young people can bring and how to define that value.  There are so many of us that define our professional brand by the number of jobs or titles we’ve had. After interviewing community builders and successful entrepreneurs, it has become clear to me that it was not their title that made them confident. Instead, great leaders knew exactly how they changed the organization for the better. It’s one of the biggest reasons I tend to resent the “fake it till you make it” mentality. It may work in certain situations. You know what works in every situation? -- Working hard -- Identifying mistakes to learn from -- Becoming more self-aware — Here are some people who are creating real value for the LinkedIn community. The return you’ll get on just pressing that follow button will be incredible. Goldie Chan, Manu Goswami Tim Salau Sam Park Michaela Alexis   #DefiningValue #LinkedInCreators 
 
 
 …see more

title: To People That Want To Start BANKING But Are Affraid To Get Started
content:
“'But nobody cares about my opinions,' they say. 'It would make me feel conspicuous.' 'They’ll care if you tell them something interesting,' I say 'and tell them in words that come naturally.'” - William Zinsser I've noticed that many people on LinkedIn feel like they don't have enough experience or expertise to start creating content. They leave it to this group of self-identified #LinkedInCreators as if the "creators" are the only ones able to give value to readers on the platform. I was reading Zinsser's On Writing Well for a class and found it incredibly relevant to why you shouldn't be afraid to put out LinkedIn content. While much of the platform's content can be technical, value doesn't have to come from verbose language and complicated analysis. Great content comes in many forms from many kinds of sources: students, CEOs, entry-level employees, stay-at-home parents, consultants, professors... I may be biased, but some of the best content I have seen is from my fellow students and young entrepreneurs. Check out some of my favorite people on LinkedIn who are creating real VALUE through their content and community building efforts.  -  Frederick Daso -  Tim Salau -  Tiara Conley -  Manu Goswami -  Sam Park -  Joel Hansen 
 
 
 …see more

title: 5 Easy Ways You Can Turn FASHION DESIGN Into Success
content:
"You don't need a great first job post-college. We're Millennials. We probably will never have the same job for more than a couple of years." I was talking to an older friend about my anxiety around graduating this May.  The advice I got was a bit discouraging. While I understand my first full-time job won't make or break my career, I wondered why I, like many Millennials, was expected to probably never have a long career at a single company.  Everyone loves talking about Millennials, and many of us have been fed an idea of whom we are:  --> self-entitled --> tech-savvy --> job-hoppers I think some Millennials have accepted job-hopping as the only realistic option for our generation to like the work we do. I always hear: "I mean, would you actually enjoy working for the same company your whole life?" I don't know yet! But I do think we shouldn't just expect to job-hop. I hope I will, at the least, stay long enough to create real, sustainable value for the companies I serve and focus more on how much I contribute than the number of years I have spent at a company. Students: Have you heard similar advice? Do you think these ideas have shaped your approach and expectations post-college? Tim ,  Kate ,  Tiara ,  Naveen ,  Annette ,  Will ,  Hana ,  Joel ,  Mrittika 
 
 
 …see more

content:
It was great to work with an outstanding video production team today. I am extremely thankful for our internal Marketing and Communications team and our external video partners, and Leadership supporting the importance of creativity! It was a long 12-hour day off site for our team, but we learned a lot about the “golden hours” for drone shots, the art of creating natural light, the diplomacy of a location pivot, how a paper towel can diffuse too much light, and the importance of humor during a tightly packed schedule. Any good marketing professional knows that spreadsheets are just as important as creative projects. However, it is more important to realize that you may never brag to your kids about the time that you spent 12 hours on a spreadsheet.  #thankful   #marketing   #creative   #leadership

title: The Philosophy Of MATHEMATICS
content:
How often do you "close the loop" in your interactions with colleague, friends, partners, customers? As we move to remote work, "clear communication" will be one of our BIGGEST CHALLENGES. It will be easy for your team to be confused  about whether you are moving forward with that project or not, what the decision was on X, or what's the next step with that customer, partner, job candidate.  Taking an intentional step to "close the loop"  and clarify the decisions made becomes SO important and SO appreciated.  Closing the loop is NOT only important on initiatives/people/projects you decided to move forward with, but more importantly with the ones you decided to leave behind.  I encourage you to take a step to close the loop with the right parties (teams, customers, candidates, partners) about topics such as:  - Decision to not move forward with a particular project/partner/customer - Decision to not fund company X (applies to VCs) - Hiring decision to reject a candidate (close the loop w/ candidate) - your clear goals for a particular project and its timeline Clearly closing the loop shows our respect & dedication to others and our determination to make tough calls.   #closetheloop   #bestpractices   #bestbusinesspractices   #hiringtips   #jobsearchadvice   #management   #leadership

title: There’s Big Money In POLITICS
content:
Is Remote Work Here to Stay? It surely seems like it! Brynjolfsson, who studied intersection of technology & economy for years argues a few interesting points that are worth attention (link to the full NPR article is below):  1) There's a lot of inertia in the way people work and it's quite hard to change the processes, the culture, the training, and the types of work. Unless there's a “SHOCK”, most people will tend to continue to do things the old way. In fact, pandemic seems to be the shock needed to push the world to “remote work” almost overnight. 2) Based on data, there’s a Productivity J-Curve when companies adopt new technologies and processes. First, there will be dip in productivity; then with further investments, adjustments, and adoptions there will be significant gains. So there could be more benefits of remote work to come when as individuals, organizations, and industries we nail  #remotework . #futureofwork   #workingremotely   #productivity   https://lnkd.in/gC3n2Y5

title: Take The Stress Out Of ART
content:
Lululemon announced to buy Mirror for $500M cash. Wow! That's quite of an exit! This is probably one of the best outcomes for a hardware tech company especially considering that the company just started 4 years ago and the product got launched just about 2 years ago.  #impressive   Mirror expects $100M revenue by the end of 2020; that's from the combination of selling Mirrors and $39/month fitness contents. This acquisition also makes it one of the most successful female founder exists in the tech world. Huge congratulations to  Brynn Jinnett Putnam ,  Hayley Bay Barna  & everyone else involved.  A few learnings from this stellar performance of Mirror and Bryann:  1) High quality products with clear value propositions win. 2) Having a software strategy and subscription model is critical for hardware companies which allows them to scale their companies in different ways and generate substantial returns.  3) Founders with strong affinity for their category, background in their industry, and vision for consumers' real needs can create magical products that scale fast.   #bestproducts   #femaleleadership   #femalefounders   #femaleleaders   #productmarketfit   #subscriptionmodel   #hardware   #exitstrategy   #mirror   #healthandfitness   #wellness   #mergersandacquisitions   First Round Capital   #fitness

title: Don't Be Fooled By MATHEMATICS
content:
As COVID-19 cases surge again, uncertainties become paramount, and pressure continues to build, we all feel tremendous amount of mental, physical & emotional burden.  One could argue that mental health is perhaps the biggest health crisis of our generation & not per se  #coronavirus .  Either way, at this point it's critical we all take steps in our daily routines to help ourselves stay sane and centered!  What do you do to help relief some of your stress? Below I shared a few things I do to stay sane during this unprecedented times:  ✅ 30-60 minute daily walk in the nature.  ✅ keep shifting my mindset from the negatives to the positives and reminding myself to count the blessings  despite all the challenges. ✅ 30 minutes of fun activities with my family in the evenings (e.g. scooter ride, art works)  ✅ stay connected to my friends, colleagues, and network. showing kindness and care for others makes you fill good. ✅ try my best to do 3-5 minutes of deep breathing a few times a week. I've started teaching breathing to my kids and use Calm kids content, which has been fun!  Please share practices you use to stay mentally healthy in the comments.  #sharingiscaring   #mentalhealth   #gratitude   #sanity   #shelterinplace   #emotionalwellbeing   #depression   #anxiety   #stress   #stressmanagement

title: 3 Things Everyone Knows About DRAWING That You Don't
content:
Facebook  Remote Work Strategy vs.  Twitter  &  Square  Remote Work Strategy: Which one did you like better?  Twitter & Square announced that all employees have option to work permanently from home. Facebook announced that 50% of its employees will work from home over the next 5-10 years. In my view, Facebook's approach is a lot more sound and serves both current employees & future hires while still drive for the best business outcomes. Here's why?    1) Facebook acknowledge the gaps and plans to solve many of the issues such as communication & creativity through building tools & technologies.   2) Facebook plans to offer remote work to more experienced employees vs. newly graduates who need more mentoring and structure.   3) It offers Remote Work option to majority of current and future employees, but acknowledges that some roles can't be remote. It's critical to be honest and open about these types of limitations. 4) Facebook's strategy came across as data driven & feedback-driven -- based on the survey results from employees.  5) Facebook officially took a stand which enables it to establish leadership in this movement. Its decisive yet conservative approach came across as more well though out.  What do you think? #remotework   #workfromhome   #flexiblework   #futureofwork 
 
 
 …see more

title: 10 Secret Things You Didn't Know About GRAPHIC
content:
CEOs of dozens of healthcare companies such as CVS, Cerner, Epic, Sanofi, and Pfizer shared their views on how pandemic is transforming their businesses and the healthcare industry as a whole. Here are some of the highlights:  ➕Telehealth is the name of the game going forward. Kasier reported that it went from 18% virtual visits to 80% almost overnight. Jefferson Health went from 15 telehealth appointments a day to 3,200 a day.  ➕Speed in healthcare has changed significantly: CEO of ChristianaCare said, "We accomplished 2-3 years of work in about 2-3 weeks."   ➕Sharing early data and novel ideas has become more comfortable. ➕Many healthcare systems have seen a 35%-55% drop in revenue as they had to shut down the most revenue-generating operations and tests in the hospitals.   ➕Public-private partnerships has been unprecedented during this time and it's expected to continue. ➕Many hospitals may change their view about their supply chain and move away from 'just in time supply' to plan for more "unpredictables" in future.  #healthcare   #digitalhealth   #healthcaresystem   #healthtech   #pandemiclessons   #futureofhealth   #telemedicine   #virtualvisits   #connectedhealth   #pandemicplanning   #disruption   #managingchange   #businessimpact

title: Want To Step Up Your MATHEMATICS? You Need To Read This First

title: Fast-Track Your POLITICAL
content:
Despite all the madness in the world, COVID-19 crisis could potentially have some positive outcomes: 1) Many schools, particularly K-12, which haven't had online contents are rushing to create digital materials for students. That will help make a leap on e-learning across all stages of education system. 2) Many other small businesses particularly the brick & mortars (e.g. ballet or piano classes) which lost their footprints are becoming more creative, creating and distributing their contents online which could unlock new business opportunities for them. 3) Organizations in totally different disciplines are coming together in new ways to cope with the coronavirus: Zoom offers K-12 students access to its videoconferencing software for free. The Gates Foundation, Wellcome & Mastercard are committing $125M in funding to companies developing treatments for the coronavirus.  4) Many companies that haven't been fully prepared to support  #WorkFromHome  needed to move to that direction. 5) Despite "social distancing," the deep human connections will get stronger & our communities will hopefully continue get tighter. China sent medical aid to Italy & Spain. Many offer help to their neighbors on Nextdoor. #positivethinking   #beingoptimistic   #elearning   #coronavirus   #covid19   #socialdistancing

Globally there're 111,758 confirmed cases of COVID-19 and 3,888 deaths so far. The  #COVID -19 mortality rate of 2%-4% is lower than those of SARS (10%) and MERS (34%); however, the unknowns and uncertainty around it caused human horror, significant economic impact, and possibly a start of a recession:  - $9+ trillion was wiped off global stocks in nine days  - 7% drop in the New York Stock Exchange at the start of the market today halted trading for 15 minutes - The S&P 500 fell ~6%  & Nasdaq was down 5.4% - $2.3 trillion expected loss of real GDP globally  - $63-$113 billion impact on Global Air Travel Many sectors such as travel, restaurants, events, entertainments, health & beauty, and brick and mortars have already been impacted by  #coronavirus  aftermath. As the businesses slowing down, they will shed full-time jobs, hourly workers won't get paid, and people will fall behind in paying rents. In this extremely difficult times, please: - be "the best human" you could be - think beyond just you, your family or your company - reach out to those who need us the most In this environment, we all could rise as leaders by doing small things! title: MATHEMATICS Works Only Under These Conditions
content:
Chris Varelas  was my 1st champion in my career! He was the Global Head of TMT, Citi Investment Banking, where I did my very first internship & then my 1st full-time job. He noticed me from the get go and connoted with me at a personal level. Through many years, he continued to be my advisor & sounding board in many big personal & professional decisions. Watching Chris in action as one of the top leaders at Citi & one of the most respected investors on the Street & in the world, taught me fundamental leadership lessons that I carried through my life:  1) As a leader, you should always keep calm & be in control of your emotions even during the most challenging times & while delivering tough news such as economic downturn of 2008 or a key executive’s departure. Teams will pick the leader’s emotions, which can help them to stay focused and confident or lose it all together. 2) Be intellectually curious. Get to know others on a personal level & always stay fun and interesting, so others care to get to know you.  3) Speak less, smile more & listen attentively. That way, when you talk and provide a point of view there’s a lot more receptivity for it.  Thanks Chris! Can’t wait to read your new book, How Money Became Dangerous.    #leadership   #leadershiplessons   #bestleaders   #founders

title: You Don't Have To Be A Big Corporation To Start MATHEMATICS
content:
"I have decided to stick with love. Hate is too great a burden to bear. "  -Martin Luther King Jr  There's so much to learn from a leader like Marin Luther King! The discriminations against one's gender, color, and background are unfortunately still prevalent at work, home, and society. We all see them & experience them. With less than 1% of Fortune 500 CEOs being Black (3 out of 500 to be exact) and only 3.2% of the senior leadership roles at large companies in the U.S. being Black, we need to change our perspectives to hiring, promoting, and empowering people of different backgrounds, ethnicities and genders. Research after research validated that diversity of all kinds in the leadership teams will result in higher business outcomes. We need to set minorities for success or else organizations will fall behind in competition and individuals will suffer. Let's stand for what's right! Let's speak up when we see people discriminate, have unconscious biases, bully, or exclude others. Change starts from each and everyone of us! Change starts with YOU!  #martinlutherking   #leadership   #changeforbetter   #changeleadership   #discrimination   #unconsciousbiases   #biasinhiring   #biasinpromoting   #diversityatwork

title: How To Find The Right GST For Your Specific Product(Service).
content:
When it comes to “business and product strategies” and picking the “winners” ONLY time will prove us right or wrong. My friends, colleagues, and peers many probably remember how bullish I was about Calm early days despite the head start that Headspace had in the mindfulness category. I had done a deep dive “product analysis” on both companies early days and despite the fact that both had great products, and that Headspace arguably had more modern design, I bet big on Calm due to some superior product experiences that Calm offered (e.g. flexibility to participate in multiple programs simultaneously, the quality and relevance of its contents). Calm from early on put users’ needs / constraints in the center of the product design and development and that’s why now they are #1 app in meditation, with over $1bn valuations, and people like LeBron behind the company. Congratulations  Alex Tew ,  Michael Acton Smith , and the team!  #bestproducts   #healthandwellness   #healthandwellbeing   #meditation   #productdesign   #customerobsession   #usercentric   Lebron James

title: How To Make Your Product Stand Out With FASHION DESIGN
content:
Powerful interview with Indra Nooyi, the Former CEO of PepsiCo; during her tenure as the CEO, PepsiCo went through amazing transformation of products and business lines and delivered incredible growth and metrics performance.  She shared invaluable nuggets of wisdom here:   1) “When you’re a female, colored woman, immigrant serving as a CEO of a large company and undertaking a transformation, there are tons of critics,” she said. “All the time you were in the public eye trying to answer the critics. So it was a "grind" all the time.” 2) Much of women’s ability to succeed at home and at work depends on existing workplace systems, which are rife with unconscious bias that “attacks women’s confidence.” 3) “All CEOs should run the company for the duration of the company, not the duration of the CEO. My success should be judged on how well my successor does, not just how well I did." Indra Nooyi  - Thank you for being such an inspiration and role model. Thank you for always keeping it real and candor which help open up larger conversations, enabling to shake the status quo.  #powerfulCEO   #femaleleadership   #worklifebalance

title: BANKING Expert Interview
content:
Happy Monday! Don’t forget that as employees, leaders, executives, board members, and investors we all have responsibilities to advocate for “what’s right” for the company. I encourage everyone to face your fears, use data and research, and stand for what’s right for the success of your company(s) every single day.  The most controversial the topic, the higher its impact (most likely), and the more important it is to stand for what’s right! Are you doing that every day?  This is very difficult in practice, as what’s right could mean different thing to various people, and what the outcome of certain decisions typically hazy. But this is were you can have “game changing” impact!  The key to do this right is to remove your biases as well as personal interests and really focus on the outcome of your decisions and behaviors on the success of the company. If the company your associated with succeed you will succeed.  #mondaymotivaton   #leadership   #leadershipgoals   #dowhatmatters

title: The Anthony Robins Guide To PAINTING
content:
Mothers are the best gift of nature! On the Mother’s Day that’s heavily celebrated and not enough for even 1% of what any woman and Mom does for her family and kids, reading a piece from a man who recently lost his wife, the mother of his two sons, reminded me that these types of days are exceptionally hard for many, many, many people! And with the power of social media, it only got worse.  I want to send my energy and love to all the kids out there who lost their mothers, to all the kids whose mothers couldn’t be there in their lives for various reasons, and to all the kids who didn’t have good relationships with their Mom because of many different social and cultural barriers.  I also want to send my prayers to all the men who lost their partner and their best friend.  Finally, I want to send my love and best wishes to those who want to have kids and so far couldn’t for biological, financial, or social reasons.  Happy Mother’s Day to those who celebrate! Each day is a precious gift. Enjoy it to the max!  #happymothersday

I found "feeling grateful" and "count my blessing" in a daily basis as one of the most powerful things that help me feel calm and collected no matter how much turbulence I feel around me.  Highly recommend utilizing gratitude! A good place to start is to count 3 small things you are grateful for every day when you wake up. Also, be nice and forgiving to yourself. Don't focus on what you "haven't done" yesterday or the goal you missed last month, but rather focus on what "you've done" from your to do list yesterday and the "progress" you made toward your "big goals".  #gratitude   #feelinggrateful   #smallwins   #positiveattitude

title: The Untold Secret To ART In Less Than Ten Minutes
content:
Rich, 15 minute episode with Katrina Lake, Founder and CEO of Stitch Fix. She’s the youngest, female CEO of a public company who has built a unicorn. 👏🏻👏🏻 She shared great advices: 1) Culture is the way to motivate employees versus amount of $ raised or made.  2) Epiphany of having diverse minds in the room will result in best outcomes that’s bigger than sum of each.  2) It’s important to zoom out (especially as the founder) from the day-to-day and be more forward looking to prevent the crazy roller coaster feeling of the startups and entrepreneurship. 3) We should evolve quickly as employees, founders, and executives of fast growing companies as things change rapidly, so we need to make sure we love our jobs at any new stage of the company and put our best into it all the time to help the company wins.  Thank you Katrina Lake for the awesome advices! We are proud of you and love what you’re doing! 👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻👌🏻 #thebestCEOs   #femalefounders   #stitc

title: How To Improve At DRAWING In 60 Minutes
content:
Happy International Women’s Day! There’s so much work to be done to create full equality, to close the pay gap, and to resolve gender bias. It’s an attempt every day! It’s an attitude of not giving up all the time!  More power to all my sisters out there who push for what they believe in, to challenge the status quo, to struggle to balance their family obligations with high impact works, and to aim to create a better future for the next generation. Although in the Western world we’re struggling for such rights as women, unfortunately in other parts of the world millions of women are still fighting for a lot more basic rights such as not being forced to marriage at young age, being raped to save their own/their families’ lives, to go to work or to school, or being able to drive. Today, I want to invite all of us (men & women) to be more aware of our own gender bias, to acknowledge women’s ideas the same way we value those of men’s, to not harshly judge women who are wearing multiple hats in families and society by none reasonable metrics, and to reach out and donate to organizations throughout the world that support women especially those help with education and prevent domestic violence, abuse, and human trafficking. To a better & brighter future!  #HappyInternationalWomensDay

title: Little Known Ways to BANKING
content:
Happy New Year!  Let 2019 be an amazing year to bring you all the personal and professional success and growth you wish for. Do you have a new year resolution?  I have a few resolutions & goals. #1 in my list is to get back to daily meditation, the habit I built a few years ago, but lost it more recently due to being extremely busy. Wearing different hats every day as an executive, mom, wife, university lecturer, startup advisor & investor, public speaker, daughter, sister, and friend left me absolutely no time for myself.  As someone who researched mental health and the benefits of meditation closely, I know that committing to do 5-10 minutes of meditation every day will bring me the focus, calm, and clearance of mind that I need and make me more effective in everything I do. So my new year resolution is to get back to daily meditation. I want to invite you all to join me in this journey and share your experiences with me throughout the year. These are some tips on how to get started:  1) Allocate the same time every day to meditate. Ideally you meditate after an existing routine (e.g. right after you wake up). That’s the best way to build a habit. 2) Set a reminder.  3) Use one of the meditation apps - Calm or Headspace.   #health   #wellness   #meditation   #newyearresolution

title: Top 25 Quotes On GST
content:
Recently, I see a few articles per week about shortcomings of Sheryl Sandberg. What bewildered me is that I don’t see as much criticism about the #1 executive, the male CEO & Founder of Facebook, Mark Zuckerberg. He’s treated like a passive Chairman of Facebook at this critical times rather than the active CEO to whom Sheryl reports.  Rather than everyone focuses on the right issues, which are the technical, security, and communication problems at Facebook, they are mistakenly making the recent Facebook events about a Female Leader failure!!! Would we have the same coverages and bashing if Sheryl was Sean Sandberg! I strongly doubt... I’m sure that Sheryl made some mistakes along the way, but I can guarantee every single male and female executives make many mistakes over decades of running companies.  I can’t help but highlight that “these high power women” who take on tough roles get “substantially unproportionate fair share of blames” when things go wrong. We saw this in terms of Marrisa Mayer and we are seeing it with Sheryl Sandberg.  I really want to invite everyone from reporters to regulators to focus on the right problems and keeping the CEO more accountable or at least as equally responsible as other executives.  #leadership   #femaleleadership   #femaleexcutive   #facebook

I also admire Melinda’s point about the fact that we don’t have “pipeline” problem for not having more women at the leadership positions, but rather we have problem retaining women at work; it’s 10x more difficult for women to balance work and life due to the false social and professional expectations.  #equalrights   #femaleadership   #retainingwomen   #womenleadership
