title: SCIENCE: What A Mistake!
content:
2 years ago, I felt that publishing my analyses on how digital health would affect a human mission to Mars would never get published in any peer-reviewed papers as I have no background in that area.  Now I just got an email from New Space that my paper is in the top 5 all-time most popular papers alongside Elon Musk's two papers. I hope he will publicly acknowledge the importance of digital health in making humanity a multi-planetary species.  Here is the open access paper:  http://bit.ly/2G6pKEM #Mars #digitalhealth  #space

title: Wondering How To Make Your BANKING Rock? Read This!
content:
Here is a cautionary tale about science journalism. An interesting study came out about a neural network designed to predict the side effects of drug combinations.  KurzweilAI used the term deep-learning while Futurity wrote that "A.I. predicts side effects for millions of drug combos". The study itself didn't mention neither A.I. nor deep learning. They only talk about the algorithm that is based on a neural network.  When news writers try to simplify the message of a study, they often over-hype technologies creating false hope.  https://lnkd.in/ehArnvK We also tend to fall into that cave too because it's really hard avoiding that. #deeplearning #writers #algorithms #neuralnetworks #futurism

title: What Alberto Savoia Can Teach You About OPERATING SYSTEM
content:
I remember watching Hank Aaron break Babe Ruth's home run record on television with my grandfather when I was four years old. It was my first realization of racism as my grandpa explained that Aaron was the best athlete alive, in his opinion, but that he wasn't treated as such by many because he was black. It made no sense to me, a child who was growing up in rural, predominantly white Minnesota but I knew what Aaron had done was a very big deal, by my grandfather's reaction. Bigger than being the best baseball player alive. I am grateful to Henry Louis Aaron for combating racism and changing hearts and minds with his talent and grateful to my grandfather for having a conversation with me that too many  parents or grandparents would likely avoid having with a four year old.  #perseverance   #champion

title: The Secret of Successful GST
content:
I will never forget September 11, 2001. I won't forget the shock of watching two airplanes fly into the world trade center and the horror of those towers tumbling to the ground, knowing there were precious lives being lost, 2977 to be exact and thousands more injured. I also won't forget how united we felt as a nation as I saw American flags on cars, homes and businesses. The way we looked at one another even though we may have been strangers, and showed shared grief in a glance. We felt sorrow and fear together and we were united in fiercely defending our nation, our freedom, from anyone who dare attack it.  I have thought a great deal about that today and how divided we are now. I wonder what the date will be that we will memorialize in future years as the final day an American died of Covid 19. I wish we were attacking this adversary as a united front and coming together rather than it pulling us apart. Where is our empathy for those among us who are physically at risk, where is our sense of duty to protect our neighbor and other members of our community? Where is our ability to understand there is much we still don't know and not knowing is not dependent on our party affiliation. I will never forget what we lost on 9/11 or who we are capable of being.   #america   #compassion 
 
 
 …see more

title: 3 Tips About BANKING You Can't Afford To Miss
content:
Attention employers and benefits managers! I am a caregiver and just spent the past 2 hours on the telephone with Medicare and a supplemental insurance company (starts with an M ends with a A) because said insurance company didn't disenroll my mother when she moved to another state 4 months ago. I called to let them know of the move when it occurred as well as notifying Medicare and SSA. Now her doctor is unable to see her unless she pays out of her own pocket because this supplemental plan is an obstacle and preventing her from getting the new plan in her new state. Her medication is necessary to prevent her from having additional strokes. I can't put this off or deal with it tomorrow. Employers, this is an example of what up to 60% of your workforce is dealing with that is impacting engagement and productivity. This is why you need to offer solutions to support working caregivers now. Covid 19 has made caregiving at least 50% more challenging. Contact me, I can quickly help you implement a plan to support working caregivers.  #employeebenefits   #workingcaregivers

title: DANCE And Love - How They Are The Same
content:
Healthcare workers are selflessly putting themselves at risk during this very scary and unprecedented time.  I remember caring for patients during a bad flu season and having to decide who got their therapy because we were working with minimal staff because my coworkers were sick too. I struggle to find the words to describe the physical, emotional and mental challenges faced in a single shift. The gut wrenching heartbreak of families saying final goodbyes can be followed just minutes later by the exhilaration of a patient who rallies, after days of teetering on the brink. I have met and had the privilege of working with some of the most successful individuals in business and technology but truth be told, they pale in comparison to many I have stood side by side with and seen perform heroic events, then quietly go home at the end of a shift. True heroes are in our midst and need our support now more than ever. 💗🙏🏻   #healthcare   #heroes 
 
 
 …see more

title: Top 10 Tips With GRAPHIC
content:
I've been thinking a lot lately about things I can do to be more present and connected to community and small ways to make a real difference. I started a list and thought I would share and ask for additional ideas. Please share yours! Take a co-worker you don't know well to lunch and get to know them better. Bring a plate of cookies or bowl of fruit to a neighbor. Start an office or neighborhood coat drive and donate winter coats to a local homeless shelter. Volunteer to listen to kids read at a local school. Let someone go ahead of you in line, just because. Put treats out for neighbors who walk their dogs. Explore a part of town you typically don't visit to shop, go to a play or musical event. Share your talent by volunteering some time to teaching even one person how to play an instrument, paint, draw, sing or act. Do handyman/woman jobs for a neighbor. Mow or take a lawn or shovel a walk for someone who needs help doing it. Organize a trash pickup day at a local park, beach, creek side... Give someone a compliment each day. Start a cooking club and take turns hosting dinner for friends. Invite a guest. Look at the checkout clerk when they say "hello" and ask you how your day is going. Ask them how their day is going too. Listen to their answer and be present.

title: Take 10 Minutes to Get Started With ART
content:
It was a pleasure visiting the Hospices De Beaune in the Burgundy region of France today.  The story of Chancellor Nicolas Rolin who in 1443 built a beautiful place to care for the poor and sick at no charge really struck me.  He didn't cut corners and great thought went into creating a beautiful, compassionate environment for healing.  Wealthier patients did pay a small fee and had more private accommodations. Many also freely donated. The church and King Louis also provided funds and nuns cared for the sick. Those funds insured that everyone received care. Nuns even made fresh bread every morning to give to the townspeople who were suffering after the hundred year war. Wine from grapes in the vineyard were sold to fund the hospital.  To this day it is a symbol of great pride and compassion in the region.   Care and compassion to those who are suffering in a community makes the entire community stronger and more peaceful. People who show up and support one another thrive.  What would happen if in America there were smaller, regional models of care like this? Could communities create and find ways to fund care for everyone rich or poor?  Would someone be willing to manage it without receiving a seven figure salary?   #entrepeneurship   #healthcare   #business   #community 
 
 
 …see more

title: Listen To Your Customers. They Will Tell You All About CRAFT
content:
Almost $27 million last year in compensation. Not a bad gig. What this tells us is that UHG is an extremely successful, highly profitable business.  A business that makes it's profits like any other business, growing money coming in and reducing expenses paid out. It's not selling coffee or shoes or even groceries. It sells healthcare coverage. Since it is a healthcare insurance company the expenses paid out are largely the healthcare costs of it's members. The incentive is tied to keeping those costs low so the company makes higher profits and the CEO is rewarded. Consider this when the insurance companies are complaining about how much it costs them to cover those of us with pre-existing conditions.  Just a little food for thought.

title: The Hidden Mystery Behind ART
10 Ways To Immediately Start Selling PHOTOGRAPHY
content:
Is "free" really free when it comes to social media platforms or other web or app based consumer products? My answer is a resounding "no" but I am not sure everyone sees it that way.  When creating alska and coming up with a pricing structure we were met with skepticism when saying we would charge customers a monthly fee of $8.99.  Some said "Consumers won't pay when there are so many free products."  Many said we should make it free to the consumer and generate revenue by selling data or advertising.  I thought it would be important for users to know that their information is protected and they wouldn't be inundated by advertisements for products or other services that may or may not be reputable.  Even when I look at competitors who claim to offer a solution to caregivers, I quickly see that they are mining data right from the initial attempt to register an account.  This turns me off immediately and I assume my customers would have the same reaction but, maybe not. Facebook still states on their registration page "it's free and always will be."  There are rumors that may change, what do you think? Would you rather pay for an application with cash or are you willing to roll the dice with your personal information and be advertised to? 
 
 
 …see more

The gift of spaceflight is a shared perspective. That’s why  Virgin Galactic  called our spaceship, Unity. So, with our next test flight window opening soon and Valentine’s Day just around the corner, we’ve been making space for love, inside our spaceship. We know that so many people around the world are separated from loved ones right now. We want to give you the chance to write a message to someone special and we’ll have it nicely designed and printed before stowing it safely aboard Unity ready for her next flight.  We’ll post it back after the flight for you to send on, as a message of inspiration, optimism for the future and most of all – love! We’ll take as many messages as possible, but at some stage we’ll have to close the cabin door, so it’s first come, first served!  Click here to get started on your own making space for love letter:  https://virg.in/9cR

The teams at  Virgin Hotels ’ properties are working hard to keep all of their guests safe. Virgin Hotels is the first hotel group in the US to work with  Mobility Mojo  to share all of the work they’re doing to ensure every guest’s return is as safe as possible. Mobility Mojo was co-founded by  Stephen Cluskey , who was left paralysed from the neck down after falling off a hay bale as a teen. His new perspective inspired him to set up Mobility Mojo, which helps hotels to evaluate and share their accessibility features. Virgin Hotels started using Mobility Mojo last year and received a gold star rating  https://virg.in/xyU

I want to say a big thank you to the  #VirginFamily  from the bottom of my heart. Your unwavering support, even when really hard decisions have had to be made, has been so humbling through the last few months. content:
Antarctica contains about 90% of the world’s ice and around 70% of the planet’s fresh water; both are vulnerable to warming air and waters. The protection of the Southern Ocean is a defining issue for our time, and it can help bring countries together. Protecting large Antarctic marine areas will boost ocean protection by an order of magnitude greater than anything achieved before. We now have a once-in-a-generation chance to do things differently and protect more than 7 million km2 of the Southern Ocean by 2020. To create the largest act of ocean protection in the history of the world, we need everyone’s help to reach one million petition signatures. Please join us and sign the petition at  only.one/antarctica . Antarctica and all of the creatures that live there need us more than ever.

title: How To Start A Business With DANCE
content:
As millions in the US and around the world take to the streets to demand an end to racism and racial injustice against black people in the wake of George Floyd’s brutal killing in Minneapolis, I am reminded of an encounter I learned a lot from more than 50 years ago. In 1967, I was 17 years old and had just launched Student Magazine to protest against the Vietnam War and other issues where I felt young people’s voices were not being heard. I was fortunate to get the rare chance to listen to James Baldwin, the brilliant African American writer and leading public intellectual. I had heard he was staying in London for a few days, so I went to his hotel and managed to secure an interview in his room. The conversation we had feels more present than ever during these days of protest.   “White people do not listen and do not care,” he said at one point, voicing his frustration at the continuing oppression of black people. “What would happen if they did listen?” I asked. “It isn’t me that they have to listen to,” he replied. “It isn’t any black man they have to listen to. It’s their own hearts and conscience.”  https://virg.in/psX 
 
 
 …see more

title: Stop Wasting Time And Start DRAWING
content:
Honoured to work in partnership with Strive Masiyiwa, Jeff Skoll and the team at Invicta to get much needed bridge ventilators and oxygen helmets to countries across Africa as cases of COVID-19 rise across the continent.  I’m so proud of the teams at  Virgin Orbit  and  Virgin Galactic  who immediately pivoted their engineering expertise to create low-cost, innovative solutions to save lives. title: 5 Reasons BANKING Is A Waste Of Time
